title: 48 Hours in Kyoto for Design-Loving Travelers

fact_report.claim: JR Haruka Limited Express connects Kansai International Airport to Kyoto Station in roughly 75 minutes and costs about ¥4,600 with the ICOCA & Haruka package.

sources.name: JR West ICOCA & HARUKA official page
sources.quote: ICOCA & HARUKA offers a discounted one-way Haruka ticket (Kansai Airport ? Kyoto) in about 75 minutes for ¥4,600.

fact_report.notes: Travel time and fare align with JR West guidance.

fact_report.claim: Kyoto City Bus & Subway One-Day Pass costs ¥1,200 for adults.

sources.name: Kyoto City Transportation Bureau Fare Table
sources.quote: One-Day Bus & Subway Pass: Adult ¥1,200, Child ¥600.

fact_report.claim: Ginkaku-ji (Silver Pavilion) charges ¥500 for adult admission and follows a one-way garden loop.

sources.name: Kyoto City Tourism Association — Ginkaku-ji
sources.quote: Admission: Adults ¥500. Visitors follow a prescribed course that circles the gardens and sand mound.

fact_report.notes: Entry fee and route are accurate.

fact_report.claim: Katsura Imperial Villa tours require advance reservations through the Imperial Household Agency and involve roughly 1.3 km of walking on gravel paths.

sources.name: Imperial Household Agency — Katsura Detached Palace Guide
sources.quote: Visitors must apply in advance. The guided course covers about 1.3 km of gravel paths; comfortable walking shoes are recommended.

research_log.quote: ICOCA & HARUKA offers discounted Haruka tickets between Kansai Airport and Kyoto in approx. 75 minutes for ¥4,600.
Admission: Adults ¥500. The route circles the sand garden and moss grounds.
Advance application required; guided tour covers about 1.3 km on gravel paths.
